content.text: Show that \(\tan \theta + \cot \theta\) can be written as \(\sec \theta \cosec \theta\)
Given that \(y = \tan x - x\), find \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}\). Write your answer in terms of \(\tan x\)
Hence find \(\int_{0}^{\frac{\pi}{4}} \tan^{2} x \mathrm{d}x\). Give your answer in exact form
Solve the equation \(8^{\frac{1}{x}} - 2 \times 8^{-\frac{1}{x}} = 1.\)
It is given that \(\left(a - \sqrt{3}\right)^2 = b + \left(3 - b\right)\sqrt{3}\) , where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers. Find the possible values of \(a\) and \(b\)
The diagram shows the triangle \(OAC\). The point \(B\) lies on \(AC\) such that \(AB:BC = p:q\), where \(p\) and \(q\) are constants \((p \neq -q)\)
Show that \(\mathbf{b} = \frac{q\mathbf{a} + p\mathbf{c}}{q + p}\)
Given that \(\log_a(p+1) + \frac{1}{\log_p a} - \log_a(p+2) + \log_a 5 = \log_a 12\), find the value of \(p\)
Find the exact value of the perimeter of the shape, giving your answer in terms of \(\pi\)
Find the exact value of the area of the shape, giving your answer in terms of \(\pi\)
In this question all lengths are in metres
The diagram shows a shape \(ABCDEF.\)
\(AB, BD\) and \(DE\) are three sides of a rectangle
\(O\) is the mid-point of \(BD.\)
\(AFE\) is an arc of a circle whose centre is \(O.\)
A curve has equation \(y = 2x \cos x\). The normal to the curve at \((\pi , - 2\pi)\) meets the \(x\)-axis and \(y\)-axis at points \(P\) and \(Q\). Find the exact area of triangle \(POQ\)
Find the time when the particle changes direction
Show that the particle is moving towards \(O\) when \(t = 0\)
Find the total distance travelled by the particle during the first 2 seconds of its motion
A particle moves in a straight line so that its displacement from a fixed point \(O\) at time \(t\) seconds is \(x\) metres, where \(x = t^{3} + t^{2} - t + 8\) and \(t \geqslant 0\)
The curve crosses the \(x\)-axis at \(x = 2\)
The minimum value of \(y\) is 3
Find the value of \(c\) in each of the following cases
Find the range of values of \(c\) for which \(y\) is always greater than 0
A curve has equation \(y = x^{2} - 8x + c\) , where \(c\) is a constant
A class contains 7 girls and 8 boys. A group of 6 is selected from the class. The group must contain at least 3 girls and at least 2 boys. Find the number of different groups that can be selected.
A 5-character code is to be formed from the following characters
Letters A B C D E F
Numbers 1 2 3
No character may be used more than once in any code. The characters may be arranged in any order
Find the number of different codes that can be formed using 4 letters and 1 number.
Use the diagram to explain why f is a function
Find \(\mathrm{ff}(x)\), giving your answer in its simplest form
Using your answer to **part (ii)** state the relationship between the functions f and \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\)
Explain how the diagram shows the relationship between f and \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\)
f(x) = \(\frac{x}{x - 1}\) for \(-10 \leqslant x \leqslant 10, x \neq 1.\)
The diagram shows the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\)
A function g is defined by \(\mathrm{g}(x) = \frac{x}{x - 1}\) for \(x \geqslant 2\). Find the range of g
A function h is defined by \(\mathrm{h}(x) = \frac{2x}{3x + 1}\) for the largest possible domain. State the domain of h
Find \(n\) such that \(a_n - b_n = 45\)
Find the smallest \(m\) such that \(a_m > 2b_m\)
Two arithmetic progressions, \(A\) and \(B\), each have 100 terms. Their terms are denoted by \(a_1, a_2, a_3, a_4, \ldots a_{100}\) and \(b_1, b_2, b_3, b_4, \ldots b_{100}\) respectively
